commitResults.messageTitle: Finish Level 1. Able to Greet, Echo, Exit
Level-2, can add response into a list and print them out after typing command
Made function to print list to take in generics instead Created the base for task class
- cleaned up Duke code to use member functions instead of static member functions - seperated some of duke variable to become member variables
Level-3 is done, able to mark and unmark tasks now
added subclasses (Deadline, event and todo) for Task make task member variables from private to protected so subclasses can inherit
remove the use of stringbuilder in task and its subclasses cause it defeats the purpose, normal string concat is about the same for small cases like this
fix some formatting issues when printing deadline and event duke is able to handle todo, deadline and event commands level-4 is done
remove the normal adding of task into list when there are no commands
just fix some formatting issues when printing for Duke
updated Expected.txt and input.txt for input testing A-TextUiTesting
Place in exceptions for duke - description of task cant be empty - if forgot /by or /at for deadline and event - if mark and unmark give an invlid task number - if no valid command
- uipdated test cases to include the exception msg
Able to delete tasks, added exceptions for it and updated the test cases
Add save functionality to tasks

Create Saving interface, made Task.java implement the interface

Add ability to save the tasklist base on modifications in Duke.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Read tasklist from file on startup
commitResults.messageBody:
Remove readFile() from Saving interface. Load should not be in save interface.

Add extra constructors in tasks and its child classes to be able to init isDone boolean.

read txt file on startup and initialise the values properly

commitResults.messageTitle: Add date parsing
Add time parsing for event and deadline command
commitResults.messageBody: If user do not input a time, no warnings will be sent, it will set default timing as 2359 assuming to be due by or done at the end of the day.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change filepath for storing tasklist data
Extract tasklist to a seperated class
commitResults.messageBody: Extract tasklist and updated Duke's functions to use the new class. This makes the codes cleaner as everything related to tasklist such as modifying or editing its values is in a seperate file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Storage class
commitResults.messageBody: Move loading and saving of tasklist from a file from Duke.java to Storage.java.

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract file loading behavior to a seperate interface
commitResults.messageBody: This helps to make Storage.java more generic. Allows other class type to be able to use storage.java to store data, and also makes the class responsible for how it extracts data from the file for itself. In Duke.java made a lambda expression to pass to storage so it can create the proper task depending on what data received.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify the window.
commitResults.messageBody: Add title and icon to the window. Also make it so the window cannot be resized.

commitResults.messageTitle: Clean up the codes for GUI.
commitResults.messageBody: Move default textUI file to UI folder. Change private to private final.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor event and deadline class.
commitResults.messageBody:
Various magic values in event and deadline class. Can cause confusion on what the values mean and make it harder to debug issues in the future.

Refactor them to no longer use magic numbers so it'll be clearer to understand and easier to change the values in the future. This will improve code quality.

Let's abstract out the magic values and declare them as named constants.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove complicated expressions.
commitResults.messageBody:
Various long and complicated expressions in various command classes.

Long complicated expressions, makes it hard to read, understand and debug the code. It is also prone to bugs if the code were to get longer.

Let's abstract and seperat out the complicated expressions to simpler more readble expressions to improve code quality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor codes to make code quality better.
Add assertions to command class.
commitResults.messageBody:
Command class getDescription function able to take in an empty input, or input without the proper command key.

Will cause a parsing bug and obtain the wrong data as the parsing of data requires heavily on the key being inside the input, or for the input to not be empty.

Let's add assertions to command class getDescription function, to ensure the key exists in the input passed in, and that the input is not empty.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add gradlew and modify gradle.
commitResults.messageBody:
Github Actions currently not working when it comes to building due to missing gradlew file. Current gradle file mainclassname is also not updated to the latest.

Need to add back the gradlew file and modify the gradle file so github action workflow will be able to run and this will make the work process much easier.

Let's add back the gradlew file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more flexibility in search.
commitResults.messageBody:
Users have to input full keywords to be able to find the tasks they want.

This can be irritating if users want to find items based on inputting the keyword partially. Being able to input the keyword partially to find the items they want will also provide a better user experience.

Let's change the find task function to accept partial keywords instead of full keywords.
